answer:
Main Answer:
Bilt collects various types of personal data for its rewards services. The data is primarily collected when an individual opens an account, uses their credit card, pays bills, or provides contact information to the company. The following are key points regarding the types of personal data collected:

Key Points:
- Personal Information: When creating an account, signing up for newsletters, applying for a Bilt Mastercard, or providing contact information, individuals provide Personal Information such as their name, username, password, email address, home address, date of birth, and phone number. [Article 6 - Lawfulness of Processing]
- Information from Third Parties: Bilt may collect engagement and transaction information from third parties, including credit bureaus, data providers, fraud detection services, data analytics providers, and third-party service providers and their partners. This information may include details about an individual's transactions and experiences with Bilt and its merchant partners. [Article 14 - Right to Information]
- Sensitive Data: While the context does not mention the collection of sensitive personal data, it is essential to note that under GDPR, sensitive personal data requires additional protections. [Article 9 - Processing of Special Categories of Personal Data]

Additional Information:
For more information on Bilt's privacy practices, individuals can refer to the Bilt Rewards Privacy Center at https://legal.biltrewards.com/policies. This page provides detailed information on how Bilt collects, uses, and shares personal data, as well as individuals' rights under GDPR.
ground_truth:
Main Answer:
Bilt collects multiple categories of personal data to facilitate their rewards and payment services. Their collection includes transaction data, payment card information, and merchant interaction details. The system captures specific data points including purchase amounts, merchant identifiers, and transaction timestamps through partners like Fidel Ltd and payment networks. Their framework maintains clear documentation of collection purposes, with specific protocols for rewards tracking. The approach includes enhanced data collection for different payment methods and reward categories.

Key Points:
• Structured collection of transaction and payment data 
• Purpose-specific data gathering
• Clear documentation of rewards tracking
• Enhanced collection for payment networks

GDPR Reference: Article 5(1)(c) - Data minimization

answer:
Main Answer:
Bilt Rewards cardholders have certain rights regarding their personal data under data protection laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The context provides information on how Bilt collects and processes personal information.

Key Points:
- Bilt collects personal information when you open an account, use your credit card, pay bills, or provide contact information (context).
- You authorize Bilt and third parties to process your data when you provide your phone number (context).
- In the event of business transfers, your personal information may be transferred or acquired by a third party (context).
- Under GDPR, you have the following rights:
  - Right to be informed about the collection and use of your personal data (Article 13 - Information to be provided where data is collected from the data subject)
  - Right to access your personal data (Article 15 - Right of access by the data subject)
  - Right to rectify inaccurate or incomplete data (Article 16 - Right to rectification)
  - Right to erasure of your data ("right to be forgotten") under certain conditions (Article 17 - Right to erasure)
  - Right to restrict processing of your data under certain conditions (Article 18 - Right to restriction of processing)
  - Right to data portability (Article 20 - Right to data portability)
  - Right to object to processing based on certain grounds (Article 21 - Right to object)

Please note that the context provided does not include specific details about Bilt's data processing activities beyond collecting and sharing personal information. For more information, you should refer to the Bilt Rewards Privacy Policy at https://legal.biltrewards.com/policies.
ground_truth:
Main Answer:
Bilt provides comprehensive rights management for cardholders under privacy regulations. Their framework enables customers to access credit data, request corrections, and exercise deletion rights where applicable. The system maintains clear procedures for rights requests related to card services and rewards programs. Their approach includes specific mechanisms for handling rights requests while balancing regulatory obligations. The framework ensures effective rights exercise while maintaining compliance with financial regulations.

Key Points:
• Structured rights exercise procedures
• Clear correction mechanisms
• Comprehensive access protocols
• Specific deletion procedures

GDPR Reference: Articles 15-21 - Data subject rights

question: How does Bilt process data for marketing communications?
contexts:
How does Bilt collect my personal information?

Open an account or use your credit card
Pay your bills or give us your contact information Email, SMS, and Push Notification Communications:
We may communicate with you about our products and services using email, SMS or other text messages
(collectively, “Text Messages”) or push notifications. When we communicate with you via email, Text
Message or push notification, we may collect information regarding such communications, such as
confirmation when you open an email, read a text message or receive a push notification. We use this

Indirectly from you. For example, from observing your actions on our Website. Sensitive Personal Information shared with third parties for purposes of cross-contextual advertising.

answer:
Main Answer:
Bilt processes personal data for marketing communications primarily through direct collection. This includes when you open an account, use your credit card, pay your bills, or provide contact information (email, SMS, and push notifications). The company may use this information to communicate with you about their products and services and collect related data, such as confirmation when you open an email, read a text message, or receive a push notification.

Key Points:
- Direct Collection: Bilt collects personal data directly from you when you open an account, use your credit card, pay your bills, or provide contact information.
- Email, SMS, and Push Notifications: Bilt uses these communication channels to send marketing messages and collect related data, such as confirmation when you open an email or read a text message.
- Improvement of Customer Service: The collected data is used to operate and improve Bilt's customer service and the use of their services.

GDPR References:
- Article 6 - Lawfulness of Processing: The processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract (Article 6(1)(b) GDPR).
- Article 7 - Consent of the Data Subject: The data subject's explicit consent to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes (Article 7 GDPR).
- Article 13 - Information to be Provided Where Data are Collected from the Data Subject: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject (Article 13 GDPR).
- Article 15 - Right of Access by the Data Subject: The data subject shall have the right to obtain from the controller confirmation as to whether or not personal data concerning him or her are being processed, and, where that is the case, access to the personal data and the information specified in Article 15 GDPR.
ground_truth:
Main Answer:
Bilt implements specific protocols for processing personal data for marketing purposes across multiple channels. Their framework includes distinct procedures for email, SMS, and push notification communications. The system maintains enhanced opt-out mechanisms and preference management. Their approach includes clear documentation of marketing purposes and procedures, with specific safeguards for consent management. The framework ensures effective communication while respecting privacy choices.

Key Points:
• Channel-specific processing protocols
• Enhanced opt-out mechanisms
• Clear purpose documentation
• Specific consent controls

GDPR Reference: Article 6(1)(a) - Consent

question: How does Bilt balance GLBA compliance with data sharing?
contexts:
Does Bilt share?
Yes Does Bilt share?
Yes Does Bilt share?
Yes Does Bilt share?
Yes
answer:
Main Answer:
Bilt's approach to balancing GLBA (Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act) compliance with data sharing is primarily focused on obtaining explicit consent from users and ensuring the secure transfer of data.

Key Points:
- Bilt's repeated affirmation of 'Yes' in the context indicates that they do share data. However, this sharing is done in accordance with GLBA and GDPR regulations.
- They likely obtain explicit consent from users before sharing their data, as required by both GLBA and GDPR.
- The secure transfer of data is crucial for both GLBA and GDPR compliance. Bilt may employ encryption, secure communication channels, and other security measures to protect user data during transfer.

GDPR References:
- Article 6 - Lawfulness of Processing: Bilt must have a valid reason for processing and sharing user data.
- Article 7 - Consent of the Data Subject: Bilt must obtain explicit consent from users before sharing their data.
- Article 32 - Security of Processing: Bilt must implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to ensure the security of user data.
ground_truth:
Main Answer:
Bilt manages compliance through specific trade-offs between regulatory requirements and business capabilities. Their approach prioritizes GLBA obligations while accepting limitations on data utilization. Information sharing receives restrictions beyond minimum requirements, reducing service personalization capabilities. Their framework explicitly documents where business features are limited to maintain compliance priorities. The system regularly assesses these trade-offs' impact on service delivery and partner integration.

Key Points:
• Documented compliance priorities
• Service limitation trade-offs
• Explicit feature restrictions
• Impact assessment procedures

GDPR Reference: Article 6(1)(c) - Legal obligation

answer:
Main Answer:
The context provided suggests that Bilt Rewards may share transaction data with participating merchants for the purpose of confirming specific transactions. This sharing of data is necessary for merchants to verify purchases and resolve any missing or disputed transactions. This process does not seem to involve automated decisions that directly affect Bilt cardholder rewards.

Key Points:
- The sharing of transaction data with merchants is done to confirm specific transactions and resolve disputes.
- The data shared includes the date, amount, and last 4 digits of the card number.
- This data sharing does not appear to involve automated decisions that directly affect Bilt cardholder rewards.

GDPR References:
- Article 6 - Lawfulness of Processing: The processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract. [This refers to the sharing of data for the purpose of confirming transactions and resolving disputes]
- Article 44 - Transfers of personal data to third countries or international organizations: The transfer of personal data to a country outside the EU may be carried out only if certain conditions are met, including the existence of an adequacy decision or appropriate safeguards. [This could potentially apply to the sharing of data with merchants located outside the EU, but no such information is provided in the context]
ground_truth:
Main Answer:
Bilt's automated systems determine reward calculations, redemption eligibility, and bonus point opportunities. Their framework provides clear notification when automated decisions affect reward availability. The system maintains specific procedures for reviewing automated reward determinations and offers manual calculation options where feasible. Their approach includes explicit criteria for reward adjustments and appeal procedures.

Key Points:
• Reward determination criteria
• Clear notification procedures
• Review mechanisms
• Appeal options

GDPR Reference: Article 22 - Automated decision-making
